original: Colliander, Sten Erland N:son, flygingenjör, Halmstad, f. 19/7/09’ i Uddevalla av major Niils Erland C. o. Signe Elisabeth Lundell. G. m. Maj Britt Lerager. Barn: Nils Gösta f. 43, Britt Marianne 46. — Stud:ex. i’ Kristianstad 29, civ:ing:ex. 37. Kontr:-ing. v. centr. flygverks t. å Malm si ät t 37, flygfÖTvaltn. bitr. kontr :àng. v. Nohab Elygmotorfabr. A-B i Trollhättan 38-39, motoring. v. flygkrigssk. å Ljungbyhed 39-41, motoring. v. flyg-förvaltn. i Sthlm 42-43, fJottiiljing. v. F. 14, Halmstad fo, ’sed. 44. Medl. av Flygv. flygingifören. o. W-Sex i Halmstad, Hobby: modelljärnv :bygge.
translated: Colliander, Sten Erland N:son, aviation engineer, from Halmstad, born on July 19th, 1909 in Uddevalla to Major Niils Erland C. and Signe Elisabeth Lundell. Married to Maj Britt Lerager in an unknown year. Children: Nils Gösta born in 1943, Britt Marianne born in 1946. He graduated from Kristianstad in 1929 and received a degree in engineering in 1937. He worked as a contracted engineer for the Central Aviation Works in Malmö in 1937 and as a deputy contract engineer for Nohab Elygmotorfabr. A-B in Trollhättan from 1938 to 1939. He was also a motor officer at the Aviation War School in Ljungbyhed from 1939 to 1941 and at the aviation department in Stockholm from 1942 to 1943. He was stationed at F. 14, Halmstad from 1944 onward. He was a member of Flygv. flygingifören and W-Sex in Halmstad. His hobby was building model railways.

structured.name: Sten Erland N:son Colliander
structured.description: Sten Erland N:son Colliander was a Swedish aviation engineer known for his expertise in the field of aircraft design and construction.
